content.text: The diagram shows a pentagon made from two congruent trapeziums.
The area of the pentagon is \(130.2 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
One titanium atom has a mass of \(7.95 \times 10^{-23} \mathrm{~grams}\).
Calculate the number of titanium atoms in \(1 \mathrm{~kg}\) of titanium. Give your answer in standard form.
Write down a possible value of \(y\).
\(\mathcal{C}=\{x: x\) is an integer and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 12\}\) \(E=\) {even numbers} \(M=\) {multiples of 3}
Find the coordinates of the point where line \(L\) intersects the \(y\)-axis.
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the point where line \(L\) intersects the line \(y=19\).
Give your answer in the form \(y=mx+c\).
The account pays compound interest at a rate of \(r \%\) per year. At the end of 4 years the value of her investment is \(\$ 1523.15\).
\(m\) is inversely proportional to the square root of \((t+2)\).
17 In the Venn diagram, shade the region \((A \cup B) \cap C'\).
By shading the unwanted regions of the grid, draw and label the region \(R\) which satisfies these three inequalities.
The diagram shows a solid cuboid with sides of length 4.5 cm, 8 cm and 13.2 cm.
Find the probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(B\).
Find the probability that Stephan picks a yellow sweet from bag \(A\) and a yellow sweet from bag \(B\).
Calculate the angle between \(AB\) and the horizontal base of the cuboid.
19 The table shows some information about the heights of 200 plants.
(a) Draw a cumulative frequency diagram to show this information.
(b) Find an estimate of the 75th percentile.
Stephan has two bags, \(A\) and \(B\), each containing red sweets and yellow sweets only. He picks two sweets at random, one from bag \(A\) and the other from bag \(B\).
The probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(A\) is \(\frac{3}{5}\).
The probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(A\) and a red sweet from bag \(B\) is \(\frac{2}{15}\).

The diagram shows an equilateral triangle \(A B C\) with all sides of length 12 cm. \(A N P\) is a sector of a circle, centre \(A\). \(N\) lies on \(A C\) such that \(A N:N C=2:1\). \(P\) lies on \(A B\) such that \(A P:P B=2:1\).
Calculate the area of the shaded region.
Find the lower bound of the mass of the cube.
The side length of the cube is 1.3 cm, correct to 1 decimal place.
Calculate the upper bound of the density of the metal.
A metal cube has mass 14.2 g, correct to 1 decimal place.
Sketch the graph of \(y=\sin x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).
The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(O X P Y\) with diagonals meeting at \(T\). \(O X=3 \mathbf{a}\) and \(O Y=12 \mathbf{b}\).
Find the ratio \(O T: T P\).
Solve the equation \(2+5 \sin x=1\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).
